numbered_ace_sentences: 1. A person can have more money.
2. If a person has more money then the person is more likely to be accepted into a prestigious school.
3. The chance of acceptance for a rich person is about 4 times the chance of acceptance for a poor person.
4. I wonder if colleges admit more students who have money.
5. I wonder if colleges admit more students who have money because these students can pay tuition faster than students who take out loans.
6. I am a senior in high school.
7. My friends are applying to colleges now.
8. I am applying to colleges now.
9. My friends are deciding where they want to go to college.
10. I am deciding where I want to go to college.
11. Household income is not as much of an issue in my community as in neighboring towns.
12. However, household income affects a good number of my peers when they apply to colleges.
13. The headline is: The effect of household income on college acceptances.
